cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast and accelerate, crossing the eastern Gulf, making landfall along Florida’s Big Bend, then tracking NE across GA/SC and off the Southeast coast into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Englewood FL to Indian Pass FL (Gulf Coast); Tropical Storm Watch – south of Englewood to Chokoloskee FL and Dry Tortugas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Rio Lagartos) and Pinar del Rio Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then Georgia and South Carolina coasts (including Port of Savannah area) mid-week.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–55 mph gusts) possible late Wed night–Thu as the core passes inland to the west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 2–4 ft of surge in tidal sections of the Savannah River and adjacent coastline during Thu high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall of 3–6 inches with locally higher totals could cause fresh-water flooding in the port area Wed night–Thu.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; temporary channel closures or navigation restrictions due to reduced visibility and cross-currents.
